smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function updateDashboard appears to be too complex.
The function initManualViews appears to be too complex.
The function initTemperatureViews appears to be too complex.
The function initKCALBackupView appears to be too complex.
The function getNLStatusIconBackground appears to be too complex.
The function updateProfileCreatorParams appears to be too complex.
The function handleIntent appears to be too complex.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class AutoFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'AutoFragment' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MainActivity' with '22' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Object 'Core' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'
Class 'NightLightAppService' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function loadProfiles is nested too deeply.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function applyNightModeAsync has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function setAlarms has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: EmptyIfBlock
smells.description: Empty block of code detected. As they serve no purpose they should be removed.

instances.message: This empty block of code can be removed.
This empty block of code can be removed.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ColorControlFragment.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the package declaration and the list of imports.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (context as Activity) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: context as Activity
Parentheses in (if (BuildConfig.FLAVOR.equals("donate")) "donate" else "generic") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (BuildConfig.FLAVOR.equals("donate")) "donate" else "generic"
Parentheses in (this < 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: this < 0
Parentheses in (this > 255) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: this > 255
Parentheses in (!autoEnabled && prevState) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: !autoEnabled && prevState

Parentheses in (autoEnabled && startTime != null && endTime != null && TimeUtils.determineWhetherNLShouldBeOnOrNot(startTime, endTime)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: autoEnabled && startTime != null && endTime != null && TimeUtils.determineWhetherNLShouldBeOnOrNot(startTime, endTime)

smells.name: UnusedImports
smells.description: Unused Imports are dead code and should be removed.

instances.message: The import 'com.corphish.nightlight.R' is unused.
The import 'android.view.View' is unused.
The import 'com.corphish.nightlight.helpers.ExternalLink' is unused.
The import 'com.google.android.material.bottomsheet.BottomSheetDialog' is unused.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: com.corphish.nightlight.design.fragments.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function handleIntent has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function onReceive has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function migrateProfile has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function backupCurrentKCALValues has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function applyOnBoot has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function determineWhetherNLShouldBeOnOrNot has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class Profile contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called apply

smells.name: CollapsibleIfStatements
smells.description: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

instances.message: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.
Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

smells.name: LoopWithTooManyJumpStatements
smells.description: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

instances.message: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

smells.name: MayBeConst
smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.

instances.message: JOB_ID can be a `const val`.
LATENCY can be a `const val`.
